excerpt: Highest gondola in the Alps, rising to a 3,883-m. summit with 360° views of other peaks & glaciers.
detail_description: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is a must-visit destination in the Alps, offering a breathtaking experience. The journey to this highest cable car station in Europe from Zermatt village takes 45 minutes, providing panoramic views of peaks and glaciers. At the top station, visitors can explore a restaurant, shop, cinema, and viewing platform showcasing famous Alpine peaks in France, Italy, and Switzerland.
name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise

excerpt: Zermatt, in southern Switzerland’s Valais canton, is a mountain resort renowned for skiing, climbing and hiking. The town, at an elevation of around 1,600m, lies below the iconic, pyramid-shaped Matterhorn peak. Its main street, Bahnhofstrasse is lined with boutique shops, hotels and restaurants, and also has a lively après-ski scene. There are public outdoor rinks for ice-skating and curling.
detail_description: Zermatt, located in southern Switzerland's Valais canton, is a renowned mountain resort offering various outdoor activities such as skiing, climbing, and hiking. The town sits below the iconic Matterhorn peak and features a bustling main street with boutique shops, hotels, and restaurants. Visitors can enjoy ice-skating and curling on public outdoor rinks. Zermatt is an ideal destination for both skiers and non-skiers alike.
name: Zermatt

excerpt: Unique museum featuring exhibits on regional history & the mountaineers who climbed the Matterhorn.
detail_description: The Matterhorn Museum - Zermatlantis, located in Zermatt, offers a unique insight into the history of the region and the mountaineers who conquered the Matterhorn. The museum documents the triumphs and tragedies surrounding the first ascent of the iconic peak in 1865. Visitors can explore a sunken village exhibit depicting different periods of time, complete with chalets, mazots, and dwellings.
name: Matterhorn Museum - Zermatlantis

excerpt: Famous alpine peak with a distinctive pyramid shape & challenging climbing routes to the summit.
detail_description: Matterhorn is a renowned alpine peak known for its distinctive pyramid shape and challenging climbing routes to the summit. It is part of the TORX program, featuring great trails in the Aosta Valley. Visitors can take a cable car to reach the terrace and enjoy stunning views of Matterhorn, Mont Blanc, Gran Paradiso, Monte Rosa, and Swiss peaks. The area also offers access to Plateau Rosa and Grotta di Ghiaccio on foot.
name: Matterhorn

excerpt: Rocky ridge reached via a cog railway & offering views of the Matterhorn & the Gorner Glacier.
detail_description: Gornergrat is a rocky ridge in Zermatt, accessible by a cog railway, and renowned for its stunning views of the Matterhorn and the Gorner Glacier. Visitors can opt for luxury hotels like Cervo Zermatt or unique stays at Riffelalp Resort 2222m or Igludorf. For activities, skiing on beautiful slopes and taking the panoramic train to Gornergrat are highly recommended.
name: Gornergrat

detail_description: Gornerschlucht, located in Zermatt, is a natural wonder that offers a scenic adventure for visitors of all ages. The gorge features wooden walkways and steps that wind through massive cliffs, providing stunning views of the swirling waters below. It's easily accessible from Zermatt village and can be reached by foot or by taking a gondola to Fury and walking down. The entrance fee is affordable, making it a great option for budget-conscious travelers.
name: Gornerschlucht

excerpt: This Alpine railway rises 10,000 feet & passes through wildlife-rich terrain with glaciers & lakes.
detail_description: The Gornergrat Railway, also known as the Gornergrat Bahn, is a renowned cogwheel train that ascends the Gornergrat mountain in the Swiss Alps. As Europe's highest open-air rack railway, it offers passengers an enchanting journey through scenic landscapes, tunnels, and bridges. With six stations along its route, the railway provides unparalleled panoramic views of iconic peaks like the Matterhorn and Monte Rosa range.
name: Gornergrat Railway

detail_description: Sunnegga is one of the premier ski areas in Zermatt, offering an exhilarating experience for skiing enthusiasts. Nestled among breathtaking peaks, it serves as a gateway to explore the vast ski domain that includes Gornergrat and Klein Matterhorn. With 29 mountains soaring above 3000 meters and nine of Europe’s ten highest peaks nearby, Sunnegga promises stunning views and thrilling slopes.
name: Sunnegga

excerpt: Accessed via funicular, this ski area at the Zermatt resort features runs from novice to advanced.
detail_description: Sunnegga, located within the Zermatt resort, is a family-friendly ski area accessible by funicular. It offers a range of runs suitable for skiers of all levels and serves as a starting point for various hiking trails. In addition to providing stunning views of the Matterhorn, this winter destination transforms into a hub for summer activities, including access to the picturesque alpine swimming spot at Lake Leisee.
name: Sunnegga

excerpt: Dramatic, snow-capped 13,665-ft. alpine mountain peak surrounded by glaciers.
detail_description: Breithorn is a dramatic alpine peak standing at 13,660 feet and surrounded by glaciers. It's one of the highest peaks in Zermatt and offers an adventurous climbing experience. With five summits, the western summit is the most accessible for climbers with some mountaineering skills. Considered one of the easiest 4,000-meter peaks to summit in the Alps, it requires a qualified mountain guide and begins with an ascent on an aerial tramway to Klein Matterhorn.
name: Breithorn

detail_description: Nestled behind the Parish church of St. Mauritius in Zermatt, Mountaineer's Cemetery serves as a poignant reminder of the perilous nature of the Alps. It is the final resting place for numerous climbers who met their fate while attempting to conquer peaks such as Matterhorn, Taschhorn, Weisshorn, and Monte Rosa. The cemetery features various types of headstones, some bearing stories of those interred beneath them.
name: Mountaineer's Cemetery

excerpt: Snow-covered 3883-m. peak with the Alps' highest cable car ride, a restaurant & Matterhorn views.
detail_description: Klein Matterhorn is a snow-covered peak in the Alps, offering the highest cable car ride in the region and stunning views of the Matterhorn. It is part of the Matterhorn Ski Paradise, which includes three main ski areas: Sunnegga, Gornergrat, and Klein Matterhorn.
name: Klein Matterhorn

excerpt: Scenic lake with a reflection of the Matterhorn, alongside walking trails, meadows & fly-fishing.
detail_description: Stellisee is a stunning mountain lake located near Zermatt in the Swiss Alps, known for its clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. Surrounded by alpine meadows and majestic peaks, it's a favorite spot for photographers and nature enthusiasts seeking the perfect shot of the mirrored peak. The glacial lake offers a tranquil setting and serves as an ideal location for nature photography.
name: Stellisee

detail_description: The 5 Lakes Walk, also known as the 5-Seenweg or Five Lakes Trail, is a renowned hiking route in Zermatt that showcases the stunning alpine landscape. This trail takes hikers through a former glacial area and offers breathtaking views of the Matterhorn reflected in three of the five beautiful mountain lakes along the way.
name: 5 Lakes Walk

detail_description: Gornergrat is a must-visit destination offering stunning views of the iconic Matterhorn mountain. The Gornergrat Railway, one of the oldest tourist railways, provides a breathtaking journey from Zermatt to this picturesque spot. At the Gornergrat Railway Station, visitors can capture free photos at the Matterhorn Photo Point and enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding Alps.
name: Gornergrat

detail_description: Rothorn Bergstation offers one of the most breathtaking views in Zermatt, with a panorama that includes the Alps and the Matterhorn. Visitors can take a cable car to reach this vantage point and then enjoy activities such as hiking or skiing down to Zermatt. The Rothorn cafe provides an opportunity to relax and savor the stunning scenery while enjoying some food. While the cable car ticket may be pricey, many find it worthwhile for the incredible experience and views it offers.
name: Rothorn Bergstation

excerpt: Classic alpine lake in picturesque surrounds known for its clear waters reflecting the Matterhorn.
detail_description: Riffelsee is a classic alpine lake located in a picturesque setting, renowned for its crystal-clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. This popular spot is easily accessible via the Gornergrat Bahn, a famous cog railway, making it a favored destination for many visitors. Situated at an altitude of 2757 meters, Riffelsee offers stunning photo opportunities of the Matterhorn without requiring extensive hiking. The 1.
name: Riffelsee

detail_description: The Matterhorn Glacier Trail is a popular choice for families and tourists seeking a more relaxed hiking experience while still enjoying the beauty of the Matterhorn. With just 150m of total incline, it's considered one of the easier hikes in Zermatt. The trail offers stunning views of the imposing Matterhorn and surrounding glacier landscapes, providing an immersive experience into the world of glaciers.
name: Matterhorn Glacier Trail

detail_description: Forest Fun Park Zermatt offers an exhilarating experience for thrill-seekers and families, with over 100 high rope courses, ziplines, and climbing challenges set amidst the stunning backdrop of the Matterhorn. The park features Swiss-made Saferoller systems to ensure safety while testing your strength and balancing skills. From the Kid's Trail for younger adventurers to the Big Trail offering various difficulty levels, there's something for everyone.
name: Forest Fun Park Zermatt

detail_description: Hinterdorfstrasse is a must-see area in Zermatt, located beyond the Monte Rosa Hotel. It's a maze of narrow lanes with weathered old wooden chalets, barns, stables, and storehouses that offer a glimpse into an earlier period of Zermatt's history. The street features 16th-century wooden buildings that are around 500 years old.
name: Hinterdorfstrasse

detail_description: Furi is a charming chalet located near the mountain station, offering a delightful taste of Alpine atmosphere. The cuisine served here is a blend of modern international dishes that are simple yet delightful. From sourdough bread and butter to Spanish croquetas and home-aged pastrami, Furi offers an extensive range of delicacies. Additionally, there's also a ski hut in the Swiss side of the resort where visitors can enjoy more culinary experiences in the Furi area.
name: Furi

excerpt: Trails lead to this tiny village set in Alpine pasture, with wooden houses, restaurants & a chapel.
detail_description: Zmutt is a charming tiny village nestled in an Alpine pasture, featuring picturesque wooden houses, inviting restaurants, and a quaint chapel. While not directly on the ski route, it's conveniently located near the piste connecting Stafel to Furri. Accessible via well-maintained trails from Zermatt, this ancient hamlet is popular among hikers who enjoy the scenic hour-long journey.
name: Zmutt

detail_description: Zermatt is a paradise for skiing enthusiasts, and the Theodul Glacier stands out as a top attraction. This glacier offers year-round skiing, making it a dream destination for winter sports lovers. Forget about being limited to specific seasons; at Theodul Glacier, every day is perfect for hitting the slopes. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the cozy and clean accommodations at Hornlihutte, adding to the overall experience of this remarkable destination.
name: Theodul Glacier

detail_description: Hinterdorfstrasse is a charming old village street in Zermatt, Switzerland, lined with traditional wooden houses that date back to the 15th to 19th centuries. These buildings, made of larchwood, offer a glimpse into the historical lifestyle of the area, serving as shelters for both people and animals. Walking along this picturesque street provides an opportunity to appreciate the architectural heritage of the region and escape the tourist crowds.
name: Hinterdorfstrasse

detail_description: Pfarrkirche St. Mauritius, situated in the heart of Zermatt, Switzerland, is a captivating historical and cultural site. This 19th-century church showcases traditional Alpine architecture and exudes a tranquil ambiance for visitors to immerse themselves in. The stone architecture and charming altars add to its allure, offering a glimpse into the past. With its clock tower reaching towards the sky, reminiscent of the iconic Matterhorn, this church holds services in multiple languages on select Sundays.
name: Pfarrkirche St. Mauritius

excerpt: Small, dark lake at the foot of the Matterhorn with a gondola station, chapel & views of Zermatt.
detail_description: Schwarzsee, also known as Black Lake, is a stunning alpine lake situated near Zermatt at the base of the Matterhorn. The trail to Schwarzsee offers breathtaking views of the iconic mountain and takes hikers through lush meadows adorned with vibrant wildflowers. The hike, which spans 5.5 miles round trip, presents a moderately challenging ascent of 2,185 feet and encompasses enchanting forests, babbling streams, and charming alpine lakes.
name: Schwarzsee

detail_description: Nestled within the enchanting Five Lakes Walk, Grindjisee is a captivating gem that offers a unique perspective of the iconic Matterhorn. Unlike its larger counterpart Stellisee, this smaller lake is tucked away in a serene valley and surrounded by charming larch trees along its southwest shore. The hike to Grindjisee is relatively easy, with some moderate sections, making it accessible for most adventurers eager to explore Switzerland's breathtaking landscapes.
name: Grindjisee

detail_description: Kirchbrücke is a popular spot in Zermatt, Switzerland, known for its stunning views of the Matterhorn. The viewing point is being expanded to accommodate more visitors and will soon have a lift installed. Nearby, there's a beautiful church next to a cemetery, making it an ideal evening visit. For the best photos of the mountain, clear sunny days are recommended.
name: Viewpoint Kirchbrücke Bridge

detail_description: Chez Vrony is a renowned on-mountain restaurant located in the Findeln area of the resort. It offers amazing food and a stunning view of the Matterhorn from its terrace. The family-owned establishment has a long tradition and is accessible by gondola or ski-in from a blue run. The restaurant is known for its warm hospitality, with owners Max and Veronika likely to greet you upon arrival.
name: Chez Vrony

detail_description: Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint is a renowned Swiss resort town located at 1,600 meters and is a popular destination for adventurers. It is part of the classic Haute Route and offers some of the best high mountain skiing in the world. Surrounded by notable mountains like Monte Rosa and the iconic Matterhorn, Zermatt attracts mountaineers and skiers from all over. The town is an ideal location for a first winter mountain holiday with its impressive venues.
name: Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint

excerpt: Riffelalp is a hamlet in the municipality of Zermatt in the canton of Valais. It is located at a height of 2,222 metres above sea level, just above the tree line, approximately halfway between the town of Zermatt and the Gornergrat mountain. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Riffelalp is a charming hamlet situated in the municipality of Zermatt, Valais. Nestled at an elevation of 2,222 meters above sea level, it rests just above the tree line and is positioned midway between Zermatt and the Gornergrat mountain. The area offers delectable cuisine featuring carefully prepared seafood, locally sourced Riffelalp cow dishes, and a seasonal menu for vegans.
name: Riffelalp

detail_description: The Matterhorn Glacier Palace is a popular tourist destination in Switzerland, attracting visitors with its stunning panoramic views and unique attractions. Situated at an altitude of 3,089m above sea level, the Gornergrat offers breathtaking vistas of the Monte Rosa massif and the Gornergletscher, one of the largest glaciers in the Alps.
name: Matterhorn Glacier Palace

detail_description: Zermatt is a top-tier ski destination known for its exceptional snow conditions and high-altitude terrain. With 245 kilometers of pistes, 73 ski lifts, and diverse runs catering to all skill levels, it's a haven for snow enthusiasts. Families can also enjoy tailored skiing experiences with qualified instructors ensuring everyone's safety and progress. Zermatt stands out as one of the best ski resorts globally, offering an unforgettable winter sports experience amidst stunning alpine scenery.
name: Family Skiing Zermatt

excerpt: Findeln is a group of hamlets above Zermatt in the canton of Valais. They are located on the south facing slopes of the Sunnegga–Unterrothorn–Oberrothorn mountains. The main hamlets are Eggen and Ze Gassen, where there is a chapel. Both are easily accessible by the Zermatt–Sunnegga funicular. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Findeln, situated above Zermatt in the canton of Valais, is a collection of charming hamlets nestled on the sun-kissed slopes of the Sunnegga–Unterrothorn–Oberrothorn mountains. The primary hamlets, Eggen and Ze Gassen, boast a picturesque chapel and are conveniently reached via the Zermatt–Sunnegga funicular. This idyllic alpine retreat offers stunning vistas and easy access to outdoor activities.
name: Findeln

excerpt: 9,642-ft. mountain offering skiing, a cable car ride & a discovery center with a VR experience.
detail_description: Trockener Steg is a 9,642-ft. mountain in Zermatt, Switzerland, offering skiing and a cable car ride. It also features a discovery center with a VR experience. The area has several lift stations including the Sunnegga lift station restaurant, Trockener Steg, and Riffelberg. Visitors can enjoy basic lunches at relatively modest prices at these stations.
name: Trockener Steg

excerpt: Seasonal, base camp mountain lodge at 3,260 meters altitude, for Matterhorn climbers.
detail_description: Perched at an altitude of 3,260 meters, Hörnli Hut is a seasonal mountain lodge serving as a base camp for Matterhorn climbers. The popular Hörnli Hut Hike spans approximately 4.5 kilometers and commences at Schwarzsee, guiding hikers through awe-inspiring alpine scenery with steep ascents into high alpine terrain. Adventurous visitors can witness climbers tackling the challenging Matterhorn summit from this vantage point.
name: Hörnlihütte

excerpt: Mountains are mirrored in the green-hued water of this small, remote lake accessed via hiking trail.
detail_description: Nestled amidst the stunning Swiss Alps, Grunsee is a picturesque lake that enchants visitors with its serene green waters reflecting the majestic mountains above. Accessible via a delightful hiking trail, this hidden gem is part of the renowned 5 Lakes Walk, which meanders through five breathtaking lakes including Grindjisee and Stellisee. The hike to Grunsee is gentle and family-friendly, making it an ideal outing for adventurers of all ages.
name: Grünsee

excerpt: Small mountain lake with dramatic Matterhorn views & kids' playground equipment.
detail_description: Nestled beneath the iconic Matterhorn, Leisee is a charming mountain lake that offers breathtaking views and a delightful playground for children. Easily accessible via a short funicular ride from Sunnegga, it serves as an excellent starting point for beginners looking to ski. While the area features moving carpets and a special Wolli pass for easy navigation, those new to skiing may find the surrounding slopes quite challenging.
name: Leisee

detail_description: The Hängebrücke is the longest pedestrian bridge in the Alps, offering a thrilling experience as you walk 85 meters above the Zermatt valley on its 500-meter-long walkway. This suspension bridge spans the Gorner Gorge and provides a magnificent view of Zermatt. The circular route from Furi to the bridge and back takes about an hour, with signposted paths and great scenery. It's important to note that this adventure is only available between May and October.
name: Hängebrücke Furi

detail_description: The Ricola Herb Garden in Zermatt offers a unique experience where visitors can learn about the 13 herbs used in their famous herbal cough drops. Located just 2.5km from Zermatt, the garden features a short hike at Blatten, allowing guests to explore the locally grown herbs and enjoy the beautiful blooms from May through September. Additionally, visitors can visit a small chapel and a mountain restaurant while taking in picturesque views of the Matterhorn from the terrace.
name: Ricola Herb Garden

detail_description: Riffelberg is a picturesque spot in Zermatt that can be reached by taking the train from Murren. Visitors have the option to explore Gornergrat and hike to Riffelberg, with the flexibility of using the Gornergrat railway multiple times throughout the day. The area offers stunning views of Riffelsee Lake and access to gentle skiing options above Riffelberg.
name: Riffelberg

detail_description: Fuchs Bakery & Bistro in Zermatt is set to introduce new and exciting additions to its menu, catering to the increasing demand for diverse culinary experiences. The bakery is expanding its offerings to include delicious vegan and gluten-free products while maintaining a focus on regional and natural ingredients. Additionally, the cafe menu will feature new dishes, promising an exciting dining experience for visitors.
name: Fuchs Bakery & Cafe

detail_description: Zermatt is a trendy destination offering a variety of hotels, including the unique Hotel Omnia which sits on a rock and features an unconventional entrance through a tunnel. The town's train station serves as the central hub, providing punctual and regular service with modern trains and convenient facilities such as free restrooms, lockers for rent, and free Wi-Fi. Visitors can explore the car-free town using e-buses or opt for local buses or cabs just outside the station.
name: Zermatt

detail_description: Mürini Hill, situated in the charming area of Le Petit Village, offers one of the most stunning viewpoints of the Zermatt Matterhorn. It is widely regarded as the best spot to admire this iconic mountain.
name: Mürini

detail_description: Experience the thrill of Zermatt Paragliding and soar over the stunning Matterhorn for a unique perspective of the mountains. Unlike other activities in Zermatt, paragliding requires no special training or preparation. You can enjoy cruising over diverse terrains and capture breathtaking photos and videos from your flight. With experienced pilots like Michael, who provide clear instructions and ensure safety, you can fully immerse yourself in this exhilarating adventure without worrying about capturing memories.
name: Zermatt Paragliding

detail_description: Rotenboden offers a variety of activities for visitors, making it an ideal destination for both skiers and non-skiers. Accessible via the Gornergrat train from Riffelberg, Rotenboden is home to the famous Riffelsee, which provides stunning photography opportunities as it begins to thaw in late spring. For those looking for alternative winter activities, there are prepared snow trails for leisurely walks and long sled runs exceeding 1 km in length.
name: Rotenboden

detail_description: Zermatt is a picturesque car-free village nestled in the Swiss mountains, offering breathtaking views of the iconic Matterhorn. Accessible via a gondola ride, visitors can enjoy impressive vistas and explore hiking trails in summer or hit the world-famous ski slopes in winter. The journey to the top provides stunning scenery, with multiple stops along the way. The tickets include local bus fare and access to attractions like the ice museum.
name: Zermatt

detail_description: The Zermatt City Tour offers a comprehensive exploration of the town's top shops, museums, and churches, providing insight into its rich culture. As a car-free village, Zermatt exudes tranquility and is ideal for leisurely strolls. While wandering through shopping streets and rural areas may lead to delightful distractions, getting lost in this magnificent place can be an enchanting experience.
name: Zermatt City Tour

excerpt: Large, retreating Alpine glacier with a rare type of lake that drains every summer.
detail_description: Gorner Glacier is a large, retreating Alpine glacier located in the Pennine Alps, southeast of Zermatt. The area offers plenty of adrenaline-pumping downhill action with numerous rugged glaciers like Monte Rosa, Theodul, Findel, Matterhorn and Zmutt. The Gornergrat observation center provides stunning views of the glacier and surrounding landscape from its rocky ridge location at 10,134 feet.
name: Gorner Glacier

detail_description: Gornergrat is a scenic railway journey that passes through the stations of Gornergrat, Hohtalli, and the picturesque Gornergratsee lake. This route offers the opportunity to capture stunning reflections of the iconic Matterhorn mountain. Travelers can use maps from swisstopo and SwitzerlandMobility to navigate this breathtaking experience.
name: Gornergrat
